oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Jack Greene and Jeannie Seely
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Jack Greene (musician) and Jeannie Seely (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jack Greene; Jeannie Seely; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Jeannie Seely, Rick Phillips and Jack Greene -- (01:06) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Seely and Greene [featuring no production] -- (01:30) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (02:01) If it Ain't Love (Jack Greene and Jeannie Seely) -- (03:16) Phillips introduces Greene and Seely to discuss their storied past in Seely's hometown -- (05:14) Alcohol commercial spot hosted by -- (05:47) Can I Sleep in Your Arms Tonight (Jeannie Seely) -- (07:49) There Goes My Everything (Jack Greene) -- (10:24) Phillips inquires about how "There Goes My Everything" came into existence, and Seely's husband Hank Cochran is discussed -- (14:48) Phillips reveals his admiration for Seely and Faron Young -- (15:30) Young performs an army radio spot -- (16:45) Lucky Ladies (Jeannie Seely) -- (18:55) Phillips performs a Veteran's Administration home loans radio spot -- (19:19) All the Time (Jack Greene) -- (22:00) Phillips inquires about Greene's time working for Ernest Tubb -- (22:58) Phillips asks Seely how she joined country music; additionally, Greene addresses similar experiences to Seely -- (26:19) It's Time to Cross That Bridge (Jack Greene) -- (28:55) Cancer radio spot hosted by Del Reeves -- (29:26) Statue of a Fool (Jack Greene) -- (32:08) Greene reflects on working with Teddy Wilbert when he discovered "Name it After Me;" additionally, Seely reflects on the state of country music -- (37:45) Sing For the Good Times (Jack Greene) -- (40:35) Seely performs a commercial break -- (40:42) Solider's Magazine commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (41:41) He Can be Mine (Jeannie Seely) -- (43:56) Phillips inquires about Seely's time as a military disc jockey -- (45:38) Wish I Didn't Have to Miss You (Jack Greene and Jeannie Seely) -- (47:46) United States savings bonds commercial spot hosted by Phillips -- (48:14) The First Time (Jeannie Seely) -- (51:19) Phillips asks Greene and Seely about their future plans, and all of them say goodbye -- (54:39) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (56:35) Phillips introduces next week's guest: Donna Fargo -- (56:43) U. S. of A. (Donna Fargo) -- (1:00:13) Fargo reflects on traveling cross-country while writing "U. S. of A." -- (1:01:05) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Greene, Jack (Singer); Seely, Jeannie; Phillips, Rick;
